title: Check for a Balanced Equation
text: Check if the equation is balanced or not. If not, balance the equation.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of $$CuSO_4$$
text: Use the equation $$\text{Moles of Reactant A} = \text{Mass of Reactant A} \times \frac{\text{Moles of Reactant A}}{\text{Molar Mass of Reactant A}}$$.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of $$CuSO_4$$
text: What is $$(1.274 \text{ g } CuSO_4) \times \frac{1 \text{ mol } CuSO_4}{159.62 \text{ g } CuSO_4}$$? Keep three decimal places.

title: Identify the Stoichiometric Factor
text: The stoichiometric factor relating the two substances of interest is $$\frac{1 \text{ mol Cu}}{1 \text{ mol } CuSO_4}$$.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of Cu
text: The molar amount of Cu is derived by multiplying the provided molar amount of $$CuSO_4$$ by the stoichiometric factor.

title: Calculate the Molar Amount of Cu
text: What is $$0.008 \text{ mol } CuSO_4 \times \frac{1 \text{ mol Cu}}{1 \text{ mol } CuSO_4}$$? Keep three decimal places.

title: Calculate the Mass of Cu
text: Calculate the $$\text{Mass of Cu with Mass of Reactant A} = \left(\frac{\text{Molar Mass of Reactant A}}{\text{Moles of Reactant A}}\right) \times \text{Moles of Reactant A}$$

title: Calculate the Mass of Cu
text: What is $$(0.008 \text{ mol Cu}) \times \frac{63.55 \text{ g Cu}}{1 \text{mol Cu}}$$? Keep three decimal places.

title: Calculate the Percentage Yield
text: Calculate the percentage yield with $$___$$ $$\text{\% yield} = \frac{\text{Experimental (actual) yield of product C}}{\text{Theoretical (calculated) yield of product C}} \times 100$$.

title: Calculate the Percentage Yield
text: What is $$\frac{0.392 \text{ g Cu}}{0.508 \text{ g Cu}}$$? Give your answer as an integer.
